nsgl.random.raw

Interface RawGenerator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaGenerator, Ranecu, Ranlux, Ranmar, RanMT, SeedableGenerator

    public interface RawGenerator

    Title: RawGenerator

    Description: Abstract class. It is a generator of uniform distributed pseudo random numbers in the interval [0.0,1.0) (x~U[0,1)). It has some useful methods for generating boolean values and uniform distributed integers.

    • Method Summary

      default int integer(int max)
      Generates a uniform distributed integer value in the interval [0,max-1]
      double next()
      Generates a random number in the interval [0.0,1.0) following a uniform distribution x~U[0,1)
      default double[] raw(double[] v, int offset, int m)

      • bool

        default boolean bool(double falseProbability)
        Generates a boolean value with the given probability
        Parameters:
        falseProbability - The probability of generating a false. Clearly, (1.0-falseProbability) provides the probability of generating a true value
        Returns:
        A boolean value with the given probability

      • integer

        default int integer(int max)
        Generates a uniform distributed integer value in the interval [0,max-1]
        Parameters:
        max - The superior limit of the half-open interval [0,max) defined for generating integer values
        Returns:
        An integer value in the interval [0,max) with uniform distribution

      • raw

        default double[] raw(double[] v,
                     int offset,
                     int m)
        Returns a set of random numbers following the x ~ U[0,1) distribution
        Parameters:
        v - Array used for returning the generated random numbers
        offset - Stating point for storing the generated real numbers
        m - The number of random numbers to be generated and returned in array v.
        Returns:
        A set of random numbers following the x ~ U[0,1) distribution

      • raw

        default double[] raw(int m)
        Returns a set of random numbers following the x ~ U[0,1) distribution
        Parameters:
        m - The number of random numbers to be generated
        Returns:
        An array with m random numbers following the x ~ U[0,1) distribution
